meanings.definition: Lack of power to produce a desired effect
meanings.sent1: The inefficacy of the old engine made it impossible to start the car.
meanings.sent2: The inefficacy of the medicine was evident when the patient's condition did not improve.
meanings.sent3: The inefficacy of the broken umbrella was comical as it failed to shield from the rain.
meanings.sent4: The inefficacy of the leaky roof became apparent during the heavy storm.
meanings.sent5: The inefficacy of the flashlight in the dark forest left them feeling helpless.

meanings.sent1: The inefficacy of the old system led to frequent errors in the data.
meanings.sent2: The inefficacy of the plan became clear when it failed to achieve the desired results.
meanings.sent3: The inefficacy of the broken clock was frustrating as it kept showing the wrong time.
meanings.sent4: The inefficacy of the worn-out tools slowed down the construction project.
meanings.sent5: The inefficacy of the faulty printer caused delays in printing important documents.
